conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graphs of two objects, A and B, moving in the same direction along a straight line.
Determine the direction of acceleration for each object during the time interval from 0 to t1.
Since both are moving in the same direction, the velocity v is positive for both objects.
Object A starts with a velocity of 0 at t = 0, increases to a maximum velocity, then decreases to 0 at t = t1.
Since the velocity of object A increases from 0 to a maximum, the acceleration must be positive.
Object B starts with a velocity of 0 at t = 0, increases to a maximum velocity, then decreases to 0 at t = t1.
Since the velocity of object B increases from 0 to a maximum, the acceleration must be positive.
Since both objects are accelerating, the acceleration of both objects is increasing from 0 to t1.
Conclude that the acceleration of both objects is increasing during the time interval from 0 to t1.
Yes, the accelerations of both objects are first increasing and then decreasing.
